responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: 'Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in IframePortlet'
    analysis: |
      The `IframePortlet` class retrieves the `iframeSource` parameter from user input and uses it to construct the URL of an iframe.
      This parameter is not sanitized before being included in the URL, making it vulnerable to XSS attacks.
      An attacker can construct a malicious URL that, when loaded in the iframe, can execute arbitrary JavaScript in the context of the Jenkins dashboard.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - setIframeSource
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/hudson/plugins/view/dashboard/core/IframePortlet.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: 'Open Redirect in IframePortlet'
    analysis: |
      The `IframePortlet` class uses user input to determine the source of an embedded iframe.
      The `iframeSource` parameter, which is retrieved from user input, is used to build the iframe URL.
      This input is not validated against a whitelist of allowed URLs.
      As a result, an attacker can set `iframeSource` to an arbitrary external URL, and the Jenkins dashboard will embed this URL in an iframe.
    cwe: CWE-601
    function_names:
      - setIframeSource
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/hudson/plugins/view/dashboard/core/IframePortlet.java
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in IframePortlet
leads.analysis:
The IframePortlet class retrieves the iframeSource parameter from user input and uses it to construct the URL of an iframe.
This parameter is not sanitized before being included in the URL, making it vulnerable to XSS attacks.
An attacker can construct a malicious URL that, when loaded in the iframe, can execute arbitrary JavaScript in the context of the Jenkins dashboard.

leads.headline: Open Redirect in IframePortlet
leads.analysis:
The IframePortlet class uses user input to determine the source of an embedded iframe.
The iframeSource parameter, which is retrieved from user input, is used to build the iframe URL.
This input is not validated against a whitelist of allowed URLs.
As a result, an attacker can set iframeSource to an arbitrary external URL, and the Jenkins dashboard will embed this URL in an iframe.
